column2: VIRGINIA DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This is:
column8: a side road sign.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column8: You must make a complete stop
column10: Yield the right-of-way to oncoming vehicles

column2: 3. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.
column6: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.
column8: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.

column2: 4. This sign warns that:
column4: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.
column8: traffic must merge left.

column2: 5. What does a flashing red light mean?
column4: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column8: Yield.
column10: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column8: Construction zone ahead

column2: 7. This sign means:
column6: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.
column8: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column10: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.

column2: 8. This sign means:
column4: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.
column6: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.
column8: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column8: Watch for vehicles entering from the side

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column8: No U-turns
column10: Right turn permitted on red light

column2: 11. What is the most important rule to remember in any emergency?
column8: Do not panic.

column2: 12. Speed limit signs are:
column8: regulation signs (regulatory signs)

column2: 13. Every time you get behind the wheel, you:
column8: must ensure you are a safe driver.

column2: 14. The speed limit in school zones is:
column8: 20 MPH

column2: 15. You can pass on the right:
column4: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.
column6: when passing is restricted by parked cars.
column8: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.
column10: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.

column2: 16. Bicyclists must:
column4: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.
column6: remain near the left edge of the road.
column8: travel with more than two side-by-side in a single lane, if possible.
column10: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.

column2: 17. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
column8: 10 minutes.

column2: 18. Double solid yellow lines mean:
column4: the lane to the right may pass.
column6: passing is permitted in either direction.
column8: passing is not permitted in either direction.
column10: the lane to the left may pass.

column2: 19. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column4: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.
column8: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.
column10: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other vehicles.

column2: 20. A broken white line:
column4: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.
column6: marks the right edge of the roadway.
column8: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.

column2: 21. When driving on a multi-lane highway, you should __________ if you are driving slower than the traffic around you.
column8: stay in the middle lane

column2: 22. To avoid the risk of being involved in an alcohol-related crash, you should:
column4: call a taxi if you've been drinking.
column6: say â€œNo, thanks" if someone offers you alcohol.
column8: decide before you start drinking that you are not going to drive.

column2: 23. ABS is the acronym for:
column8: Anti-Braking System

column2: 24. Drivers must yield the right-of-way to:
column6: pedestrians crossing a public street or highway.
column8: funeral processions.

column2: 25. When approaching a stopped school bus with its red lights flashing and its stop arm extended, you must:
column4: stop only if children are present.
column6: stop and remain stopped until it appears safe to proceed.
column8: stop 15 feet away from the bus.
column10: stop and remain stopped until the red lights stop flashing and the stop arm has been withdrawn.

column2: 26. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column8: move to another lane if possible.
column10: increase your speed as you are probably driving too slowly.

column2: 27. If you drive without liability insurance coverage on your vehicle, in Virginia you face:
column8: driver's license suspension.

column2: 28. How can you prevent fatigue on a long trip?
column6: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.
column8: Schedule regular stops for every couple of hours.

column2: 29. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.
column10: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.

column2: 30. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column6: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column8: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

column2: 31. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
column6: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.
column8: Take your foot off the gas and shift to neutral.
column10: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.

column2: 32. Which of the following does NOT affect the distance that it takes to stop your vehicle?
column8: Braking distance.

column2: 33. Unlike passenger cars, trucks have blind spots:
column8: reserved for blind people.

column2: 34. One broken line indicates:
column4: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.
column6: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.
column8: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.

column2: 35. Traffic lights are normally ____________ from the top to bottom or left to right.
column8: red, green and yellow

column2: 36. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column8: Whoever enters the intersection first.

column2: 37. Parking is not allowed:
column4: on the road side of a parked vehicle.
column8: in a tunnel.

column2: 38. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column6: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.
column8: signal turns, lane changes and stops.

column2: 39. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column8: of a headlight failure.
column10: that a tire blowout is about to occur.

column2: 40. Trucks, buses and RVs have:
column4: much larger blind spots than cars.
column8: blind spots the same size as cars.
column10: much smaller blind spots than cars.
